intro: Sphaerocoryne affinis, commonly known as the globular sea holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Goodeniaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its spherical, fleshy, greenish-blue stems that are covered in small, leaf-like structures. Its flowers are small and typically white or pale blue, arranged in dense clusters. Sphaerocoryne affinis thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments.
